byline.original: By ALEXANDER BURNS and KATE TAYLOR

abstract: Eva S Moskowitz, head of Success Academy Charter Schools, announces she will not run for New York City mayor in 2017, sparking question of whether anyone from school-choice movement will challenge Mayor Bill de Blasio; Moskowitz has persistently presented herself as alternative to de Blasio on issue of school choice and was widely thought of as threat to de Blasio's re-election.
lead_paragraph: Ms. Moskowitz, the head of the Success Academy network, had been perceived as a potential obstacle to Mayor Bill de Blasio’s re-election.

headline.main: Eva Moskowitz, Charter School Champion, Says She Won’t Run for Mayor
headline.print_headline: Mayor’s Rival Announces She Won’t Run in 2017 Race

snippet: Ms. Moskowitz, the head of the Success Academy network, had been perceived as a potential obstacle to Mayor Bill de Blasio’s re-election.
